author: Nope
post_text: December 9, 2019 at 5:46 AM#1Is it possible to add an agenda item via a macro? I don't want any popup boxes or anything. I just want the item to be added without the current operator having to the worry about it. An example of how it would be used is say I wanted to add an agenda item to do something 5 minutes from now.Thanks in advance!

posts.author: Nope
posts.post_text: December 9, 2019 at 5:46 AM#1Is it possible to add an agenda item via a macro? I don't want any popup boxes or anything. I just want the item to be added without the current operator having to the worry about it. An example of how it would be used is say I wanted to add an agenda item to do something 5 minutes from now.Thanks in advance!

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: December 10, 2019 at 10:47 PM#2yes it is possible to create Agenda Items via generic commandline.check out the keywords: Store, Assign and Agenda in the manual.for your specific scenario, "do something 5 minutes from now" you would use a countdowntimer, not Agenda.check out the keywords: Store, Assign and Timer in the manual.

title: Add Agenda Item Via Macro
